DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Nodal And Extranodal Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Description of the anatomic location of progression of disease for malignant lymphoma.  This includes lymphatic and/or extralymphatic progression.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Lymphoma First Cancer Progression Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body._A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ma-LIG-nant) Cancerous; a growth with a tendency to invade and destroy nearby tissue and spread to other parts of the body.:A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Concepts.definition: Refers to abnormal cell activity manifested by decreased control over growth and function, causing tumor growth or spread into surrounding tissue and adverse effects to the host.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released per approval by B. McClure-Shimel. mc 10/5/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Situated outside of a node._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

Concepts.definition: A flattened, roughly triangular body resting upon the upper end of each kidney; it is one of the ductless glands furnishing internal secretions (epinephrine and norepinephrine from the medulla and steroid hormones from the cortex).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.  The fluid may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum. -- 2004: The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, and mesentery. It consists of the parietal peritoneum that covers the inside of the abdominal wall and the visceral peritoneum that covers the surface of the intestine and mesentery.

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.
The tissue that lines the wall of the abdominal cavity, intestine, mesentery, and pelvic organs. It consists of the parietal peritoneum and the visceral peritoneum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located above and adjacent to the elbow.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located above and adjacent to the elbow.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the upper inner portion of the thigh.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the upper inner portion of the thigh.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the hilum of the lung.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the hilum of the lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.

Concepts.definition: The cartilaginous structure of the respiratory tract between the pharynx and the trachea. It contains elastic vocal cords required for sound production.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx in the back of the throat, at and above the soft palate. The nasopharynx is continuous with the nasal passages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the retroperitoneal space.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the retroperitoneal space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

Concepts.definition: The section of the intestines between the pylorus and cecum. The small intestine is approximately 20 feet long and consists of the duodenum, the jejunum, and the ileum. Its main function is to absorb nutrients from food as the food is transported to the large intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine. The stomach is the primary organ of food digestion.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node which is located above the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

Concepts.definition: An endocrine gland located at the base of the neck that produces and secretes thyroxine and other hormones. Thyroxine is important for metabolic control.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova; surrounding this stroma is a more condensed layer of stroma called the tunica albuginea.

Concepts.definition: One of the paired female reproductive glands containing the ova or germ cells; the ovary's stroma is a vascular connective tissue containing numbers of ovarian follicles enclosing the ova.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (or-o-FAIR-inks) The middle part of the throat that includes the soft palate, the base of the tongue, and the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.

Concepts.definition: The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

Concepts.definition: The structural organ comprised of specialized connective tissue that forms the skeletal components of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located beneath the floor of the oral cavity.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located beneath the floor of the oral cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the hilar region of the spleen.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the hilar region of the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

Concepts.definition: An organ that constitutes the external surface of the body. It consists of the epidermis, dermis, and skin appendages.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A recess, cavity, or channel.

Concepts.definition: A recess, cavity, or channel.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An exocrine gland that secretes saliva.  Salivary glands are mostly located in and around the oral cavity.

Concepts.definition: An exocrine gland that secretes saliva. Salivary glands are mostly located in and around the oral cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

Concepts.definition: The terminal portion of the gastrointestinal tract, extending from the rectosigmoid junction to the anal canal.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

Concepts.definition: The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Lymph node located within the fat layer of the knee joint.

Concepts.definition: Lymph node located within the fat layer of the knee joint.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.: Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

Concepts.definition: The tissue that lines the wall of the thoracic cavity and the surface of the lungs.

Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye.: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in, or located in the area around the orbit of the eye.
A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

Concepts.definition: A conical membranous sac filled with serous fluid in which the heart as well as the roots of the aorta and other large blood vessels are contained.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located close to, on, or within the parotid gland. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located close to, on, or within the parotid gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The largest of the three paired salivary glands, located in front of the ear.

Concepts.definition: The largest of the three paired salivary glands, located in front of the ear.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-encapsulated elongated and lobulated organ, extending from the concavity of the duodenum to the spleen; it consists of a head, an elongated body, and a tail. It contains two functional components: an exocrine component that secretes juices into the intestine and an endocrine component that secretes hormones (insulin and glucagon).

Concepts.definition: An organ behind the lower part of the stomach that is the shape of a fish and about the size of a hand. It is a compound gland composed of both exocrine and endocrine tissues. The endocrine pancreas makes insulin so that the body can use glucose (sugar) for energy. The exocrine pancreas makes enzymes that help the body digest food. Spread all over the pancreas are areas called the Islets of Langerhans. The cells in these areas each have a special purpose. The alpha cells make glucagon, which raises the level of glucose in the blood; the beta cells make insulin; the delta cells make somatostatin. There are also PP cells and D1 cells, about which little is known.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Situated outside of a node.: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Situated outside of a node.
Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the back of the head adjacent to the trapezius muscle.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the back of the head adjacent to the trapezius muscle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: By or having to do with the nose.: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: In reference to the nose.
A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the mesentery.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the mesentery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mediastinal; related to the mediastinum.: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.

Concepts.definition: Related to the mediastinum.
A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located in the mediastinum. Mediastinal lymph nodes are arranged in three groups, one on the lateral, another on the medial, and a third on the anterior aspect of the vessels; the third group is, however, sometimes absent.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located in the mediastinum. Mediastinal lymph nodes are arranged in three groups, one on the lateral, another on the medial, and a third on the anterior aspect of the vessels; the third group is, however, sometimes absent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

Concepts.definition: The two innermost layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord, the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secret the metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining the homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

Concepts.definition: One of the two bean-shaped organs located on each side of the spine in the retroperitoneum. The right kidney is located below the liver and the left kidney below the diaphragm. The kidneys filter and secrete metabolic products and minerals from the blood, thus maintaining homeostasis. On the superior pole of each kidney there is an adrenal gland. Each kidney and adrenal gland is surrounded by fat.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Within the eyeball.

Concepts.definition: Within the eyeball.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A superficial or deep lymph node located in the inguinal area.

Concepts.definition: A superficial or deep lymph node located in the inguinal area.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located along the external iliac artery.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located along the external iliac artery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the three lymph nodes of the pelvis: the superior gluteal, interior gluteal or sacral.

Concepts.definition: One of the three lymph nodes of the pelvis: the superior gluteal, interior gluteal or sacral.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

Concepts.definition: The portion of the digestive canal between the pharynx and stomach. It is about 25 cm long and consists of three parts: the cervical part, from the cricoid cartilage to the thoracic inlet; thoracic part, from thoracic inlet to the diaphragm; and abdominal part, below the diaphragm to the cardiac opening of the stomach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the space between the wall of the spinal canal and the covering of the spinal cord. An epidural injection is given into this space.

Concepts.definition: Having to do with the space between the wall of the spinal canal and the covering of the spinal cord. An epidural injection is given into this space.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A crescent-like structure located in the upper and posterior surfaces of the testis. It consists of the efferent ductules and the duct of the epididymis. It facilitates the maturation of sperm that is produced in the testis.

Concepts.definition: A crescent-like structure located in the upper and posterior surfaces of the testis. It consists of the efferent ductules and the duct of the epididymis. It facilitates the maturation of sperm that is produced in the testis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any of the lymph nodes located in the neck.

Concepts.definition: Any of the lymph nodes located in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

Concepts.definition: An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

Concepts.definition: One of approximately 20-30 lymph nodes in chain formation that traverse the concavity of the underarm to the clavicle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Small tissue projection existing as a cecal diverticulum with a questionable history of vestigial versus specialized organ.

Concepts.definition: Small tissue projection existing as a cecal diverticulum with a questionable history of vestigial versus specialized organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

Concepts.definition: A hollow, thick-walled, muscular organ located within the pelvic cavity of a woman. Within the uterus the fertilized egg implants and the fetus develops during pregnancy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

Concepts.definition: Either of the paired male reproductive glands that produce the male germ cells and the male hormones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A thin, transparent mucous membrane that covers the posterior surface of lids (palpebral conjunctiva) and the outer surface of the sclera (bulbar conjunctiva).

Concepts.definition: A thin, transparent tissue divided into the palpebral conjunctiva (covering the inner side of the eye lid) and the bulbar conjunctiva (covering the eyeball).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa.  Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

Concepts.definition: The bony cavity of the skull which contains the eye, anterior portion of the optic nerve, ocular muscles and ocular adnexa. Seven bones contribute to the structure of the orbit: the frontal, maxillary, zygomatic, sphenoid, lacrimal, ethmoid, and palatine bones.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-in-TES-tih-nul) GI.  Refers to the stomach and intestines.: Of, or related to, the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Of, or related to, the abdomen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Mediastinal; related to the mediastinum.: Within the thorax.

Concepts.definition: Related to the mediastinum.
Within the thorax.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

Concepts.definition: The part of the large intestine measured from the cecum to the rectum consisting of ascending, transverse, descending and sigmoid portions. The purpose of the colon is to remove water from digested food prior to excretion.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The upper jawbone in vertebrates: it is fused to the cranium.

Concepts.definition: The upper jawbone in vertebrates; it is fused to the cranium.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The largest and strongest bone of the FACE constituting the lower jaw. It supports the lower teeth.

Concepts.definition: The lower jaw bone holding the lower teeth.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.: Situated outside of a node.: To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Recognized, familiar, or within the scope of knowledge.
Situated outside of a node.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

Concepts.definition: The distensible sac-like organ that functions as a reservoir of urine, collecting from the kidneys and eliminating via the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

Concepts.definition: The fluid that is contained within the brain ventricles, the subarachnoid space and the central canal of the spinal cord.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A pear-shaped organ just below the liver that stores the bile secreted by the liver, delivering the bile through the bile ducts into the intestines to help with digestion.

Concepts.definition: A pear-shaped organ located under the liver that stores and concentrates bile secreted by the liver. From the gallbladder the bile is delivered through the bile ducts into the intestine thereby aiding the digestion of fat-containing foods.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The fibrocartilaginous, mucous-lined tube passing from the larynx to the bronchi.

Concepts.definition: The fibrocartilaginous, mucous-lined tube passing from the larynx to the bronchi.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated NCIt definition to most current version. mc 2/15/13

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Nodal; of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Situated outside of a node.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Situated outside of a node.
Named locations of or within the body.
